DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Countrymark no longer leases the tanks at this site. tanks are removed

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
BWX Technologies - LPG Storage
1400 Old Highway 69 S
Mt. Vernon, Indiana  47620

RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The six (6) 30,000 gallon capacity LPG cylinders are owned by BWX Technologies, but leased to Countrymark Cooperative, Inc. Refinery, 1200 Refinery Road, Mt. Vernon, Indiana.   As requested by the lessor, Countrymark has prepared this RMP Plan.

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facility:  This LPG storage facility is believed to comply with NFPA - 58 requirements for LPG storage.  It is the policy of BWX Technologies and Countrymark Cooperative, Inc. to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the policy of both BWX Technologies and Countrymark to immediately notify Mt. Vernon or Posey emergency services.   A written Emergency Response Plan is in place.  

A description of your facility and the regulated substances handled:  BWX Technologies is a manufacturing facility, but no longer uses the LPG tanks.  Countrymark leases the LPG Tanks to ensure adequate storage for Iso-Butane in the event of a  maintenance shutdown.

The worst-case release scenario:  The worst-case release scenario is failure of one 30,000 gallon storage tank, resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  Based upon EPA's RMP program, the distance to the endpoint is .4 mile.  There are businesses and at least two homes within the distance of the endpoint, with an estimated population of 100 not including business hour employees.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:  This storage facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes or regulations.  The LPG system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with NFPA - 58 and state law.

Five year accident history: There has been no recorded accident involving the LPG storage facility.

The emergency response program:  In the event of an emergency involving

the LPG storage facility, it is our policy to notify Mt. Vernon and Posey County emergency authorities and request that they respond to the emergency.  We have submitted the Tier II hazardous materials inventory information and discussed this policy with Mt. Vernon and Posey County authorities.  The written Emergency Response Plan is on file at both BWX Technologies and Countrymark Cooperative, Inc.

Planned changes to improve safety:  None
